Matt: Why bother planning food, flowers, invitations? You should just drag

Olivia: Hi.

Olivia: Okay. I may have overstated my situation with Frank.
Alan: Excellent work, Milton. I assure you I will not forget this.
Lizzie: Granddad.
Alan: Well, is everything all right with the baby?

Alan: Well, your mother told me you had an appointment with the doctor, and I

Alan: Now sweetheart, you are not alone in this. The whole family is behind

Lizzie: I want Coop. Jenna and I want Coop.

Alan: Coop is out of the picture permanently, and I think you need to start

Lizzie: It's so hard.
Alan: I know, I know. But remember, she's a Spaulding, not a Cooper.

Lizzie: She's not even born yet. And actually, if you want to be technical,

Alan: Never. Now, she's a Spaulding, and she will be named appropriately. I'm

Lizzie: You know, I actually think that Jonathan would have stayed away from

Alan: He made a serious mistake defying me, and he will regret the day that 
he returns to Springfield, I assure you.
Jonathan: Nothing like breaking and entering. ( Laughs )

Tammy: So this is the plan? You're going to be cute and funny, and we're not

Jonathan: There is nothing to talk about.
Tammy: You stood up to Alan Spaulding in front of the whole town, Jonathan.

Process server: Are you Jonathan Randall?
Jonathan: Yeah, what about it?
Process server: You've been served.

Tammy: Great.

Jonathan: Yeah. But, hey, it's going to be fine. We are fine. We're fine. 
Come on, let's go back in the tub.

Lizzie: Okay, okay. I will admit that some of the things I've been doing

Lizzie: Okay, yeah, but I am over all of that, Granddad, seriously. From now

Lizzie: Sure. Anything healthy.

Alan: No, you will be living with us. From the very start, this baby will be

Ava: Sorry. Oh, my God. I forgot to water the plants. They're very thirsty.

Vanessa: Honey, can I talk to you just for a second?

Buzz: Hey, Frank, you're back. How are things out there?

Buzz: Frank, I'm sorry about Olivia, you know?

Lamaze coach: The birth process is a normal, natural, and healthy one.

Alan: Hello, Jonathan. Just got your message. Did you get mine?

Dinah: If it's okay with you.

Buzz: Hey.
Ava: Hi.

Buzz: I couldn't help noticing something is bothering you. You know, if you

Olivia: You know, it must be hard living with a man that you care so much

Frank: It's a nice speech, Olivia. I know everything.
Lizzie: What do you want?
Tammy: I told you: For all of us to be able to get along.

Lizzie: What do you mean?

Tammy: I'm invested in this baby, too, you know? I really think that we can 
make it work.
Lizzie: Why should I be believing this?

Tammy: Don't believe it. I'll prove it to you. You need a lamaze partner, 
right?
Lizzie: That's how it works.
Tammy: Count me in. I can be there for you and the baby.
Lizzie: You would do that?
Tammy: Yeah, I would.

Jonathan: Listen, old man, you and your flunkies aren't going to run me out 
of town. Foreclosure notices, cancelled credit cards? Do you think that's enough 
to rattle my cage? Do you?
Alan: Is that all you have to say, Jonathan? Because if it is, it's a pity.
Jonathan: What are you doing?

Alan: I want to make one thing very clear to you, young man. You started this 
war between us when you didn't accept my offer. But I assure you, I will finish 
it.
Next on "Guiding Light"...

Jonathan: Your family comes between me and Tammy, things are not going to 
work out so good for you and the little one.
Tammy: There's no way. This has got to stop.
Olivia: You want the truth?
Frank: Yeah that would be nice, actually.
Olivia: The truth is...
Buzz: We both came to our senses. Neither one of us want to hurt Frank.
Ava: It's too late.
Buzz: What do you mean it's too late?
Olivia: Oh, that lying, skinny, goo-goo eyed bar witch!
